Name: oid
Description: Row identifier

Name: conname
Description: Constraint name (not necessarily unique!)

Name: connamespace
Description: The OID of the namespace that contains this constraint

Name: contype
Description: c = check constraint, f = foreign key constraint, p = primary key constraint, u = unique constraint, t = constraint trigger, x = exclusion constraint

Name: condeferrable
Description: Is the constraint deferrable?

Name: condeferred
Description: Is the constraint deferred by default?

Name: convalidated
Description: Has the constraint been validated? Currently, can be false only for foreign keys and CHECK constraints

Name: conrelid
Description: The table this constraint is on; zero if not a table constraint

Name: contypid
Description: The domain this constraint is on; zero if not a domain constraint

Name: conindid
Description: The index supporting this constraint, if it's a unique, primary key, foreign key, or exclusion constraint; else zero

Name: conparentid
Description: The corresponding constraint of the parent partitioned table, if this is a constraint on a partition; else zero

Name: confrelid
Description: If a foreign key, the referenced table; else zero

Name: confupdtype
Description: Foreign key update action code: a = no action, r = restrict, c = cascade, n = set null, d = set default

Name: confdeltype
Description: Foreign key deletion action code: a = no action, r = restrict, c = cascade, n = set null, d = set default

Name: confmatchtype
Description: Foreign key match type: f = full, p = partial, s = simple

Name: conislocal
Description: This constraint is defined locally for the relation. Note that a constraint can be locally defined and inherited simultaneously.

Name: coninhcount
Description: The number of direct inheritance ancestors this constraint has. A constraint with a nonzero number of ancestors cannot be dropped nor renamed.

Name: connoinherit
Description: This constraint is defined locally for the relation. It is a non-inheritable constraint.

Name: conkey
Description: If a table constraint (including foreign keys, but not constraint triggers), list of the constrained columns

Name: confkey
Description: If a foreign key, list of the referenced columns

Name: conpfeqop
Description: If a foreign key, list of the equality operators for PK = FK comparisons

Name: conppeqop
Description: If a foreign key, list of the equality operators for PK = PK comparisons

Name: conffeqop
Description: If a foreign key, list of the equality operators for FK = FK comparisons

Name: conexclop
Description: If an exclusion constraint, list of the per-column exclusion operators

Name: conbin
Description: If a check constraint, an internal representation of the expression. (It's recommended to use pg_get_constraintdef() to extract the definition of a check constraint.)
